meanings.definition: A person holding a title or office.
meanings.sent1: The titularies of the school were the principal and the vice principal.
meanings.sent2: The titularies of the book club included the president and the secretary.
meanings.sent3: The titularies of the chess club had a 'checkmate' party to celebrate their titles.
meanings.sent4: In the kingdom of Chessland, the titularies were the rulers of the chessboard.
meanings.sent5: The titularies of the debate team were known for their eloquent speeches.

meanings.definition: The title or name of a person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The titularies of the book were 'The Adventures of Tom Sawyer'.
meanings.sent2: The titularies of the movie were 'The Lord of the Rings'.
meanings.sent3: The titularies of the pet show were creative names like 'Fluffy' and 'Whiskers'.
meanings.sent4: In the land of imagination, the titularies were the magical names of enchanted beings.
meanings.sent5: The titularies of the restaurant dishes made customers eager to try them.

meanings.definition: The official title of a bishop or archbishop.
meanings.sent1: The titularies of the church were Bishop John and Archbishop Smith.
meanings.sent2: The titularies of the cathedral were Bishop Thomas and Archbishop Brown.
meanings.sent3: The titularies of the chess pieces in the bishop's set were 'Bishop' and 'Archbishop'.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of chess, the titularies were the powerful bishops and archbishops.
meanings.sent5: The titularies of the religious leaders inspired reverence among the congregation.
